pros: Great people and management Great facilities Amazing culture Highly inclusive
cons: Some departmental issues Smaller college resulting in research limitations

pros: I had three different positions simultaneously for the 3.5 years I worked for UW-Stout as a student and immensely enjoyed all of them. Got to know Stout staff and my professors much better Interacted with new people from various departments Very flexible scheduling Fair workloads Good managers On campus so can easily be built into your class schedule
cons: Pay could be better, but you do get a 25-cent raise every semester, and more if your manager approves it.

job_title: Peer Writing Tutor in Menomonie, WI
pros: This role allows you to assist others in a friendly and laid-back environment. When not helping students, you can work on homework or anything you'd like. The workplace was also flexible when I needed to occasionally work remotely.
cons: There were few cons to this job, the main two of which are likely out of the employer's control due to restrictions. These being limited working hours available, and fairly low pay.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Menomonie, WI
pros: Good hours and good coworkers
cons: Low pay, unclear expectations of how to preform job duties

review_title: good benefits, decent pay, work environment usually decent
pros: Amazing and cheap health care benefits! I've had good luck with co-workers, and the one time I needed to bring up a concern about my boss, I was listened to.
cons: Custodial used to have a much smaller work load per person. From talking to some office workers, other people are also being asked to take on more responsibilities without getting raises or even recognition for their hard work. You're not paid based on your worth.

review_title: A great place to work while in school

Students from every CS class can come here for help, so you learn about every professor's teaching style.

cons: Hours don't often coincide with when students need help, so you are often alone and not really doing what you're supposed to do: help out people

review_title: Good if you're a slacker. Bad if you want any type of career growth.

cons: Toxic boys club atmosphere at times. Work is pised onto a single person while other sit around and do nothing. University has little regard to its employees. Impossible to get performance-based raises. No room for growth. A lot of talk about professional development with zero follow through.

pros: Nice people to work with

pros: Excellent Benefits, great time off, great retirement program, great coworkers.

pros: Great Staff, Good Hours, Free Housing

review_title: There is a reason Stout places 98% of their students
pros:
Fellow professors were very engaging and extremely helpful to make sure that I had a successful experience teaching.  They really cared deeply for the students they taught and mentored.  
Stout gives a lot of freedom to establish the curriculum that you teach.
Due to the mandatory internship requirement students in my classes had hands on experiences that allowed them to appreciate what was being taught because they saw how it had or could be applicable to what they will be doing after graduation.  
Students are motivated in classes because they know you are leading them to a great job after graduation.
Stout actively recruits lecturers/professors with significant industry experienced.  It was a great experience to share what was taught and learned throughout my career with these great students.  I think everyone who has enjoyed a good career should teach at least one class to pay forward the blessings one has received on one's career.
I tell you, it was really rewarding watching the young men and women I taught walk across the stage to receive their diplomas.  So proud of them.
cons:
Typical state run institution bureaucracy was really difficult to get my arms around after being in industry.  A lot more paperwork and hoops to jump through e.g. getting expenses paid. 
Pay was a bit low, but pay was not why I chose to devote a year of my time there.

pros: Lovely coworkers, Lots of resources, great sense of community, fantastic collaborators with the university
cons: Nothing I love this job

job_title: Business Systems Analyst II in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Very friendly environment, small knit community and nice campus. Hands on learning.
cons: I have no cons at this time.

pros: Fun and well-paced work environment
cons: Can be difficult to balance work and class

pros: Great atmosphere and people to work with. Flexible hours
cons: Low pay rate. Short staffed at beginning of school year.

review_title: Good benefits, great co-workers, bad bosses
pros: Benefits are good, scheduling is flexible, paid vacation and sick days.
cons: Bosses tend to forget that people are people and mistakes happen. Also they pile on the work and get mad when you can't get it done.

pros:
Nice work environment
Understanding boss
Nice school benefits
cons:
Cliquey staff
Small work space 
7 am work meetings

pros:
Friendly People 
Adaptable
Good Pay
This is a good place to get experience when you are starting out as a designer.
cons: I can't think of many cons except being the only designer on staff for The Counseling Center.

review_title: Good people, OK Culture, Wages are Rough
pros:
The majority of staff were committed to seeing the students get the best experience they can in nearly all aspects, bot academic and campus activity related.  The staff I worked with did everything they could to go above and beyond to make things work and it was a great team environment.
Benefits are pretty good.
cons:
Politics still play an unfortunately large part in how decisions get made on campus and unfortunately that impacts people who have no say in the matter.  Additionally, the governor has not been helping to make things easier for people.  Departments have had to cut staff which means more people are working more hours or programs are being cut or impacted because people can't put the required time in to make them great.
Also a very low opportunity for advancement because hardly anyone leaves their position to make room for promotions.

review_title: Great Spot for a Retirement Position
pros: The university is friendly, easy to navigate and has very good job stability and personal development opportunities. I found it to be a very supportive environment. Fantastic leave, medical, dental and other benefits.
cons: The largest downside I have found is that there is limited space for upward movement. Positions seem to be very locked in place and poor performing employees are rarely removed. This blocks upward movement from within the organization and makes the organization slower and less efficient overall.

review_title: Working for Housing - the reason for my career!
job_title: Desk Services Manager in Menomonie, WI
pros: Excellent mentorship, large amounts of personal and professional development, and very flexible hours. I have learned a ton through working in housing for three years, and have made some amazing connections that have helped mentor me through my career path.
cons: Nights and weekends meetings/duty, almost 2 weeks of training. A lot of work is due up front, but after you get through that the rest of the time is really rewarding.

job_title: SLS Tech Services Technician in Menomonie, WI
pros: Do not have to travel to work, since I go to college here. The Work Study program is very convenient to use while working on campus. I am getting experience for my field of IT while studying and taking classes on the same campus.
cons: The job doesn't pay well, due to  limited funding that is received from  the state (it is a government job.)

pros: I worked in the PARQ office and I learned a lot of helpful information and how to use certain software's. I feel I learned a lot of hands on skills working at the PARQ office.
cons:
The office I worked at had many introverts, and it was a quite office. 
Communication was a problem at times as well.

pros: It was a very interesting work environment, variety of tasks, always something to do, and I felt very needed / essential to the success of office goals. Got to meet a lot of students.
cons: Sometimes there was a lack of communication which made productivity suffer. Lack of organization. There were delays in getting my account set up, which slowed everything down.

job_title: IT Helpdesk Technician in Menomonie, WI
pros: Management works with busy student and life schedule and is flexible when things come up. Replacements for shifts are easy to find as co-workers also live flexible student lives.
cons: None that I can think of. Wage is competitive with other jobs offered on campus. Less than a 5 minute walk depending on which student dorm you are in.
